result.execSummary:
The defendant Rashed Devon Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Go Armed with Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rashed Devon Moore in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.  Additional statements by Delisha E. 

As to Count 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 6 months in the House of Correction.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months.

As to Count 2:  Defendant ordered to serve 6 months in the House of Correction with credit of 1 day time served, and with Huber Privileges for work and school. FORTHWITH. 

Conditions of Probation as to Count 1:  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.  No illegal drugs.
*Full-time work and/or school.
*No possession of any dangerous weapons. 
*No possession of any illegal drugs.
*Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Defendant Rashed Devon Moore in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered. Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Case adjourned in  branch 45.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Rashed Devon Moore in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rashed Devon Moore in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date in branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no dangerous weapons or firearms.
No driving without a valid license.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Rashed Devon Moore in court.  Thomas L. Potter  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 45.
As of 8-1-2015, case will be reassigned to Branch 23, Judge Grady.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7-27-2015 at 1:30pm

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07/02/2015

07/02/2015
